snippet: Four days after a landslide destroyed El Cambray II, burying hundreds, officials noted the risks to residents, many of whom said they would not move.

byline.contributor: Nic Wirtz reported from Santa Catarina Pinula, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.
byline.original: By NIC WIRTZ and ELISABETH MALKIN

abstract: Residents of a Guatemala City suburb are reluctant to leave after landslide kills 152 people in neighboring settlement, despite government's urging and lingering threat of more landslides.
lead_paragraph: Four days after a landslide destroyed El Cambray II, burying hundreds, officials noted the risks to residents, many of whom said they would not move.

headline.print_headline: Officials in Guatemala Urge Residents to Leave Settlement Hit by a Landslide
headline.main: Officials in Guatemala Urge Residents to Leave Settlement Hit by a Landslide
